content.title: Karkhandar Scheme For Development Of Craft Sector
content.beneficiary: Pass-out trainees and ex-trainees from departmental training centers
content.details: A training and skilling upgradation scheme by the Department of Industries & Commerce and implemented by the Directorate of Handicraft & Handloom, Government of Jammu & Kashmir wherein passout meritorious trainees and ex-trainees from departmental training centers are identified and are provided skill upgradation training in crafts which are facing human resource crunch as well as in languishing crafts. Registered Karkhanas/Karkhandars are identified who are willing to enroll a batch of trainees and ex-trainees in their Karkhana. A minimum of five trainees for a small Karkhana and a maximum of 10 trainees for a big Karkhana. A minimum of one and a maximum of five training programs per craft shall be considered for the six-month duration of the training program.
benefits: Rate of stipend per trainee/ per month: ₹2000/- (₹1000/- shall be paid through an individual bank account and the rest of the amount shall be disbursed on the successful completion of probation/ practical training session).
The trainees are facilitated in the opening of Bank accounts under the Pradhan Mantri Jan-Dhan Yojana (PMJDY).
Logistic Charges/Honorarium to Trainer/Karkhandar: ₹ 2000/- per trainee per month.
The Karkhandar is provided a lump sum of ₹25,000/- per batch as expenditure on account of all the logistics needed for running the training program successfully.
eligibility: The applicant must be a pass-out trainee/ex-trainee from a departmental training center.
The departmental training center must be run by the Handicrafts & Handloom Department.
The applicant must have an Aadhaar linked Bank Account.
content.application_process: Offline. Take print of the format of the application form and the Affidavit provided in Annexure-A & Annexure-B of the scheme guidelines. Duly fill and sign the Application Form and the Affidavit, attach the self-attested copies of the supporting documents along with a passport-size photograph, and submit the same to the given address: Directorate of Handicrafts & Handloom, Govt. of Jammu & Kashmir, J.L.N. Udyog Bhavan, Railhead Complex, Panama Chowk, Jammu, Jammu & Kashmir - 180 016.
documents_required: Registration Card (Handicrafts & Handloom Department, Govt. of Jammu & Kashmir) (if registered)
Supporting documents regarding the number of wholesalers/ retailers/ exporters/ e-commerce portals with whom market linkages have been established by the Karkhandar

faqs.question: Will The Benefit Be Provided As A One-Time Assistance?
faqs.answer: Yes, the benefit will be provided as one-time assistance.

faqs.question: Who All Can Apply For The Scheme?
faqs.answer: Meritorious pass-out trainees/ex-trainees of the departmental training centers to opt for registration under the Karkhandar Scheme.

faqs.question: What Financial Assistance Will Be Provided To The Karkhandar?
faqs.answer: The Karkhandar shall be provided a lump sum of ₹25,000/- per batch as expenditure on account of all the logistics needed for running the training program successfully.

faqs.question: Is There Any Minimum Educational Qualification Required To Avail Of The Benefits Under The Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, trainees from any educational background can apply to this scheme.

faqs.question: Can Pass-Out Trainees Apply To This Scheme As Well?
faqs.answer: Yes, both present and pass-out trainees from departmental training centers are eligible for the Karkhandar Scheme.

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Number Of Trainees Allowed Per Karkhana?
faqs.answer: A minimum of five trainees for a small Karkhana and a maximum of 10 trainees for a big Karkhana.

faqs.question: What Is The Duration Of The Craft Training Programme?
faqs.answer: The duration of the training programme shall be six months.

faqs.question: Who Is The Implementing Agency For The Karkhandar Scheme?
faqs.answer: Directorate of Handicraft & Handloom, Govt. of Jammu & Kashmir is the Implementing Agency for the Karkhandar Scheme.

faqs.question: Will The Financial Assistance Under This Scheme Be Provided In Cash?
faqs.answer: No, the disbursement of the amount of financial assistance shall be through DBT mode only.
